newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish May external reserves rise by 300 mln punts.
newsitem.headline: Irish May external reserves rise by 300 mln punts.

text.p: Ireland's official external reserves rose by 300 million punts to just over five billion in May, the central bank said on Thursday.
"Foreign currency swaps, EU receipts and a valuation adjustment which increased the Irish pound value of the reserves contributed to this development," the bank said in a statement.

The net external liability of all credit institutions rose by 620 million in May following a large fall in April, reflecting net forward purchases of foreign currency by resident banks, the central bank said.
